fineTuneArea_h.introTxt1: Use the PTZ controls to fine-tune the position of the view area. The toolbar displayed immediately below the video stream provides various buttons to play and stop live video stream, Snapshot, View Full Screen, and Emulated Joystick/Center mode buttons as described under Live View > The Viewer Toolbar.
fineTuneArea_h.introTxt2: Zoom - the camera will zoom in on a chosen area with a mouse-click.
fineTuneArea_h.introTxt3: It is also possible to control the camera view by using Click-in-image movement, which has two different types of navigation; Center and Joystick.
fineTuneArea_h.introTxt4: Center mode means that when clicking in the image, the view will center on the position that was clicked.
fineTuneArea_h.introTxt5: Joystick mode moves the view in the direction of the mouse pointer, relative to the center of the image. To use this method, point to a location in the image and then press and hold the left mouse button. The view stops moving when the button is released.
fineTuneArea_h.stepTxt1: Using the Pan, Tilt and Zoom (PTZ) controls, move the camera view to the required position. Before using Joystick Mode, zoom into the image first.
fineTuneArea_h.stepTxt2: When satisfied with the view area, click OK to close the dialog and click Save under View Areas.

viewAreas_h.intro_Txt1: This page contains the tools to define up to 8 specific areas of the overview image called View Areas that will be treated as different video sources. These areas will then each have their own Video Stream and PTZ settings.
viewAreas_h.multiViewAreaIntro_Txt: This page contains the tools to define up to
viewAreas_h.multiViewAreaIntroCont_Txt: specific areas of the overview image called View Areas that will be treated as different video sources. These areas will then each have their own Video Stream and PTZ settings.
viewAreas_h.new_intro_Txt: This page contains the tools to modify the settings of the overview image called View Areas that will be treated as different video sources. These areas will then each have their own Video Stream and PTZ settings.
viewAreas_h.new_intro_Txt-1: This page contains the tools to modify the settings of the overview image called View Area that will be treated as a different video source. The area will have its own Video Stream and PTZ settings.
viewAreas_h.new_intro_fisheye_Txt: This page contains the tools to modify the settings of the overview image called View Areas that will be treated as different video sources. These areas will then each have their own Video Stream and PTZ settings. Note that, it is possible to modify the View Area settings but you can not add or remove View Area.
viewAreas_h.viewAreaOpticNote: Note: View Areas is not available when Optical Live Zoom is selected as a PTZ mode.
viewAreas_h.viewAreaUploadableDrNote: Note: View Areas is not available when Uploadable PTZ driver is selected as a PTZ mode.
viewAreas_h.intro_Txt5: When setting up a view area it is recommended that video stream resolution be the same size as or smaller than the view area size. Setting the Video stream resolution larger than the view area size implies digitally scaled up video after sensor capture, requiring more bandwidth without adding image information.
viewAreas_h.addAreaTxt1: To add a new view area:
viewAreas_h.addAreaTxt7: Select a view area name in the list.
viewAreas_h.addAreaTxt3: Under Selected view area, enter a descriptive name for the area.
viewAreas_h.addAreaTxt4: Choose an Aspect ratio and a Video stream resolution from the drop-down list.
viewAreas_h.addAreaTxt5: The first time an area is created it covers the whole overview image. With the help of your mouse size and position the box over the desired area of the overview image.
viewAreas_h.modifyAreaTxt: To modify an area select the name of the desired view area. Reposition the area with the help of your mouse or change settings as needed. Click Save.
viewAreas_h.removeAreaTxt: To delete an area click the name and click Remove. Note that the default view area cannot be removed.
viewAreas_h.intro_Txt6: When setting up a view area it is recommended that video stream resolution be the same size as or smaller than the view area size. Setting the Video stream resolution larger than the view area size implies digitally scaled up video after sensor capture, requiring more bandwidth without adding image information.
viewAreas_h.intro_Txt8: From the drop-down list choose the Video stream resolution.
viewAreas_h.intro_Txt9: The first time an area is created it covers the whole overview image. With the help of your mouse, resize and position the box over the desired area of the overview image.
viewAreas_h.intro_Txt11: When setting up a view area it is recommended that video stream resolution be the same size as or smaller than the view area size. Setting the Video stream resolution larger than the view area size implies digitally scaled up video after sensor capture, requiring more bandwidth without adding image information.
viewAreas_h.intro_Txt12: Choose an Aspect ratio and a Video stream resolution from the drop-down list.
viewAreas_h.intro_Txt13: The first time an area is created it covers the whole overview image. With the help of your mouse size and position the box over the desired area of the overview image.
viewAreas_h.viewArea_areaName_Txt: Area name: Displays the name of the selected View Area.
viewAreas_h.viewArea_resolution_Txt: Resolution: Choose a video stream resolution from the drop-down list. Note that a corresponding aspect ratio is automatically set.
viewAreas_h.viewArea_enablePTZ_Txt: Enable PTZ - Check this box to enable PTZ in the view area.
viewAreas_h.viewArea_aspectRatio_Txt: Aspect ratio - is a ratio of width to height in images, 4:3 is a common in television screens and computer monitors while HDTV uses 16:9.
viewAreas_h.viewAreanameTxt: Name - Displays the name of selected view area.
viewAreas_h.aspectRationTxt: Aspect ratio - is a ratio of width to height in images, 4:3 is a common in television screens and computer monitors while HDTV uses 16:9. Select the aspect ratio for the view area.
viewAreas_h.videoStreamResTxt: Video stream resolution - This drop-down list gives the available video resolutions for the view area, depending on the aspect ratio chosen.
viewAreas_h.viewTxt: View area size - Shows the size of the view area.
viewAreas_h.enablePTZTxt: Enable PTZ - Check this box to enable PTZ in the view area.
